title: so, what do you do when your main goes meta (10% or more pickrate)?
body: so, Talon has a pickrate of 10% currently and I really don't like seeing my mains going meta as the risk of a mirror match and/or someone taking that champion is higher. What do you do if it happens to your main?

replies.body:
I'm not trying to be hipster but I generally stop playing that champion for a while because, I don't know, I don't like being compared to other people who play it, I just don't feel like I'm good enough to pick a popular, strong or FoTM champ without making a poor showing.

It also sucks when you main a champ and then some first timer does better in their first ever game on that champion than you ever will on them, no matter how hard you try and it just feels bad. 

The only popular or powerful champion I feel semi-comfortable playing is janna atm and that's because she's been kinda stable for a while and you don't see janna so much in lower elo and people still don't expect much from her despite her strength and so I generally won't disappoint anyone on my team too much. I generally wait till a champion gets nerfed pretty hard and falls to a pretty low winrate/popularity before I pick them up again.

I still sometimes play kinda of popular champs sometimes because my champion pool is small and I still haven't earnt much IP to buy champs on my account yet despite playing for almost a year and also some of the champions I own are too mechanically challenging for me to play.
I also don't like how most of the champions I can play are actually sort of middle level popularity because I only just started to get the hang of them. {{item:3070}}
